locations.name: Nairobi
locations.description: Kenya's capital city, serving as the starting point for the tour, offering a 'gentle introduction' before heading to wildlife areas.

locations.name: Laikipia Plateau
locations.description: A high-altitude conservation area north of Nairobi, known for its private conservancies, dramatic landscapes, and unique wildlife like Grevy's zebra and rhino.

locations.name: Maasai Mara
locations.description: Iconic wildlife ecosystem in southwestern Kenya, famous for its high concentration of animals, the Great Migration, and the Big Five. The stay is indicated to be in a private conservancy bordering the main reserve.

locations.name: Zanzibar
locations.description: An island archipelago off the coast of Tanzania, known for its stunning beaches, turquoise waters, and historic Stone Town, providing the relaxation part of the tour.
